basics.name: Charles Desneuf
basics.label: Software Architect & Tech Coach Freelance
basics.summary:
I trully believe that it is the combination of a real problem, an appropriate organization, a well-thought-out product, and quality tech that creates value for users. I view myself as someone who connects the various skills of my clients' teams, opens the doors to other ideas, to help them create the best possible solutions.

 I do this by bringing a mix of technical and architectural skills, facilitation technics, an interest for product management and an agile mindset.

work.name: West Finance
highlights: Coaching the team on technical practices and delivering value more often
Facilitating workshops to gain business knowledge
Helpin the team make architectural choices
work.summary: I help the team at West Finance deliver a software for streamlining the process of selling appartments.

work.name: CircularX
highlights: Conducting interviews to have an understanding of the current state of the system and the organization
Facilitatin multiple workshop sessions (EventStorming) to grasp the complexity of their business
Helping the team reflect on the part of the system in need for attention to reach their objectives
Helping the team reflect on a potential new organization to realign software and teams
work.summary: We helped the team at CircularX reflect on the current situation of their software system and imagine a future state for it based on the understanding of the business they are serving and the current company priorities. The future state will also serve as the basis for realigning teams with software subsystems.

work.name: Daxium
highlights: Facilitating retrospectives to improve the team delivery of features
Improving test suite execution time by a factor of 5
Mentoring developers
work.summary: I helped the team reflect on their organization and see what they could change to improve their delivery. I also participated in legacy remediation efforts.

work.name: PlayPlay
highlights: Facilitating Kata in Mob Programming setting
work.summary: I facilitated mutiple dojo sessions with PlayPlay back-end team

work.name: Kiplin
highlights: Facilitating Event Storming workshops to better understand the various needs served by the solution and to determine a possible new architecture
Redesigning existing systems
Introducing and enhancing automated tests
Developing new features
Pair programming with team members to introduce new concepts and practices, such as reactive programming and refactoring.
work.summary: I assisted the Kiplin team in transforming their IT system to better accommodate the growing size of the team and the increasing complexity of the current solution.

work.name: Agicap
highlights: API Development
Discussing about the architecture and possible ways to structure the solution
work.summary: I helped the team at Agicap introduce a new product line dealing with online payments.

work.name: Convelio
highlights: Introducing tests in a legacy codebase
Refactoring of a legacy application
Introducing BDD practices to increase communication between developers and business people
work.summary: At Convelio we moved a core part of their system that makes quotation for artwork transportation from a legacy piece of software to something more manageable. We've introduced testing, oriented-object programming, and started creating a communication channel between the tech team and the rest of the company.

work.name: Evaneos
highlights: Coaching teams towards more predictable delivery
Sharing design and architectural principles with team members
Paricipating in company-wide architectural decisions
Facilitating discovery workshops
work.summary: My role at Evaneos was to help teams deliver value in a sustainable way. I worked hand in hand with team members in order to identify what should be delivered in order to achieve the company goals in an efficient way without compromising quality and long term throughput.

work.name: Evaneos
highlights: Managing team of back-end and front-end developers
Working hand-in-hand with Product Managers to deliver the right feature
Creating APIs
Running the tech community of practices by organizing dojos and facilitating mini conferences
Sharing knowlege with peers
Refactoring legacy code
Facilitating workshops
work.summary: I was in charge of building tools for our internal users and improving our customer flow. I quickly started to run the tech community of practices to help spreading knowlege accross teams

work.name: La Netscouade
highlights: Developing of one of the web agency product.
Developing of social websites for major clients.
work.summary: Conception and development of website in web agency La Nestcouade

volunteer.name: Association Bring Music
volunteer.summary: With friends from my music band, we decided to organize events to promote local artists.

projects.name: Améliorer vos tests automatisés
projects.description: A video course I've written, recorded and edited on practices that makes our tests easier to deal with, read and maintain over the long run.

projects.name: Speaker
projects.description: I like to share ideas with others and had the opportunity to speak at various events in France
highlights: De CRUD à DDD pas à pas: Moving from an CRUD application developped with RAD tooling to a more business oriented system
Faire grandir une équipe technique: Sharing some of the ideas we've tried at Evanos to scale the tech team from 5 to 45 persons
Les exceptions, oui, mais pas n'importe comment: Explaining my mental model on how we should deal with exceptions
PhpStorm = <3: Showing that mastering an IDE gives us superpowers when it comes to refactoring or writing boilerplate code
Recette de tests: Explaining various ideas to make tests that are easier to understand and maintain
Tester du legacy grâce à l'Approval Testing: Demonstrating that it's possible to add tests on a system even if it has some random behaviours
Vous n'avez pas besoin de ça: Ranting about the complexity of our projects and sharing ideas to adapt the right level of complexity to the problem we are solving

projects.name: Burritalks.io
projects.description: I curate a list of talk I found interesting for software developers and all people working in software companies.
